author: timbeiko
content:
> How about a vote üòÑ 
> 
> 1Ô∏è‚É£  `GASPREMIUM`
> 2Ô∏è‚É£  `MINER_PREMIUM`
> 3Ô∏è‚É£ `MINER_INCENTIVE`
> 4Ô∏è‚É£  `MINER_TIP`
> 5Ô∏è‚É£  `MINER_FEE`
> 6Ô∏è‚É£ `MINER_PAYMENT`
> 7Ô∏è‚É£ `INCLUSION_FEE`
> 8Ô∏è‚É£ `MINER_REWARD`

Given that we haven't solved the "meta naming" conversation, does anyone object renaming the bribe to `MINER FEE` for now? I've gotten more negative feedback about bribe and am eager to just update the spec for clarity. This will also have all three terms using "fee". If we want to find a naming scheme that uses "price", we can do that later.

author: madeof_tin7509
content: Made a visual version I think is quite cohesive.

author: madeof_tin7509
content: Could change to Gas Price

author: timbeiko
content: <@!187490121698770945> This is great! One small thing: could you maybe change "Protocol Fee" to "Base Fee" (to match current terms)?

author: madeof_tin7509
content: Sure

author: timbeiko
content: Also, maybe we should have another box wrapping everything for "Fee cap" (The maximum you are willing to pay for a transaction)

author: madeof_tin7509
content: Like this?

author: timbeiko
content: Yes, perfect üòÑ !

author: madeof_tin7509
content: Asked for feedback on Twitter. Let's see if it makes sense to a broader audience. üòÖ

author: sky.cactus
content: I no longer desire "Miner Bribe", but for the same reason I also do not like "Miner Fee".

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm quite concerned that when users see "fee" they will think that it represents an amount, but really it is one component of a fee and by itself is pretty meaningless to end users.

author: sky.cactus
content: If we switch `Fee` in all three places to `Price`, then I'm fine with the proposed terms otherwise.  `Gas Price, Base Price, Miner Price`

author: timbeiko
content: Here's a proposal by <@!550420431744794624>: https://twitter.com/CarlBeek/status/1328377571780812803

author: timbeiko
content: `base price`, `price cap`, `inclusion incentive`. The last term is Eth2-compatible, which is nice. I'm a bit against `gas price` because it is still used for legacy transactions, so it will cause confusion to have two things with the same name.

author: timbeiko
content: I think we can colloquially use `gas price` to refer to the sum of `base price` + `price cap` (e.g. how much did the user end up paying for the transaction), but as part of the spec I'd rather have distinct terms which can have clear definitions.

author: timbeiko
content: Relatedly, does anyone think it would be valuable to have a "Definitions" section in the EIP itself ü§î ?

author: madeof_tin7509
content: Definitions section in the EIP is a great idea

author: madeof_tin7509
content: Between Price and Fee, only the term Miner Price seems weird too me. The rest seems fine

author: madeof_tin7509
content: Inclusion incentive seems pretty obtuse and although accurate I am not sure people will know what it means without a lot of clarification around deeper context.

author: madeof_tin7509
content: Changing to price seems like a good call, as I needed to talk about it as a price to clarify here.

author: madeof_tin7509

author: timbeiko
content:
How about miner premium? Only works for Eth1, but it's pretty clear. We can change variable names when we migrate to Eth2 üôÇ 

So base price, miner premium, price cap
